Great for couples group and families 
I really recommend this place to my friend.

I have been going to this restaurant for over 30 years.  I have always gotten excellent service.  My current favorite server is David.  The fresh tuna that my boyfriend eats is always fresh.  Their tempura udon soup is excellent.  I have never had a sushi roll there that I didn't enjoy.  One of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.

Always love eating here. Service is always prompt and portion sizes are decent. 911 rolls and the (tonkatsu) are my favorite.  Don't forget to end on some delicious tempura ice cream. 

One thing I deducted a star for was due to them serving wild caught bluefin tuna. Unfortunately, the species is predicted to be extinct by 2012.

we always have birthdays here, they have great food, i have tried probably half of the items on the menu, the sushi is great, and they servers know us. we love the late night hours, and the late night prices. try it out

Its exterior looks like an unassuming hole-in-the-wall. We came for a late lunch with barely anyone around and sat up at the front with the sushi chef. We ordered a variety of sushi rolls, nigiri and sashimi. They all tasted very delicious and fresh. I hadn't tried uni since high school when I decided I didn't like it and I was shocked to find that the piece I tried that day was actually quite palatable to me. I guess guess my tastes of changed. I quite liked their mackerel and the overall variety that they offered for their fresh sushi bar. Very impressive and would likely try again..

Japanese lasagna sushi..one word. Heaven!! The best I've ever had and no where else makes it the same believe me I always compare..it must be the sauce. Also a great place for late night sushi. Occasionally they play live music on a piano and it's a very atmosphere. Always suggest this place whenever anyone wants sushi but it's slightly pricey that's the only thing. Its quality and great service which I think is so worth it. Kid friendly but even more enjoyable on a date night.  Enjoy!

I extremely lover this restaurant! My favorite place ever and the food is amazing especially the beef and chicken is cooked perfect and tender and prices were great as well but cheaper if you eat the same thing just lunch hours but totally worth it either way!

We were this place last night. We ordered the medium size sashimi place,$50.00,it was such thin slice fish, quality was so so. 
Also we ordered some salad ,we ordered beef salad, but we got tuna salad. It was taste ok.
And 2 shrimp tempura udon, that was the most suck thing, the noodle was even under cook!no body can eat it.
I gave one star just for the busboy JUDY, he was very nice for help, we spend over 200 dollars for four people we still feel hungry ,however I still leave good tips just for we get Judy's help , hope I didn't spell wrong his name. 
A suck experience!

DO NOT BE SCARED WHEN YOU WALK IN.
The entrance hall looks like a crack house. The restaurant you see when you get there is cramped and claustrophobic. so ASK FOR A BOOTH.There is a charming, intimate room in the back, shoes off, kneel down japanese tables.
The food and service is great, a little pricier than several local places.

Busy at 2:30 in the afternoon. This is one of the few off strip high quality places in Vegas. We had the Roppongi roll, 911 roll and Tiger Rolls, all incredible. The bldg/decor is not that great bit the food is top quality. The Toro ranks at the top. Prices very reasonable.

I have been coming here for the last two years, and the service is friendly and warm; But as recent as last week, I notice they have new waiters and they aren't as friendly.  The sushi is consistently fresh, although it might not be the best cut like those I've had in Orange County. But if you're into tempura, this is the best place to go; it beats Frenzy Sushi in OC's tempura rolls. 
The chef here are creative and they consistently create rolls that incorporate the East and West ingredients to provide customers with one of a kind experience. 
If you like to try as many different roll as possible,go for it and get half roll instead of full roll, and trust me it's worth it. The tempura rolls are party-in-your-mouth good. I think it's great place to try to bring your love ones who are a little iffy about trying raw fish.  They won't notice because of the freshness of the fish and also the tasty sauce that come with it. 
Other than the roll, their nigiri and sashimi are alright.  The uni is another good one to try, very fresh and buttery.  I got my sister to try it, and she's not a big sushi fan.

How can I be going to this place for 14 years and am just getting around to a review now?  I guess because I am too busy eating Japanese Lasagne ;)  Yes, that is your dessert, true sushi believers, trust me.  Ask for Mika and the nice fellow with short hair who gave me green tea once.  Also, splurge on their very special T-shirt that has a Sumo wrestler saying "will work for sushi."  You'll get it after your Osaka addiction has begun.  At the end of your meal, ask for an Osaka frequent card since you can use it as a credit on your next meal!  Ok does everyone know to leave your shoes outside the tatami room with toes outward?  You'll be instantly recognized as a regular ;)

Their food is amazing. The tatami rooms are just add ons to the whole dining experience.  The unagi bowl is WORTH IT. A little pricy but all sushi places are. If you get tired of buffet, definitely try this place.

The only reason this is getting 2 stars is because the Filet Tataki was amazing.. But this is sushi, not a steakhouse. 
We have been waiting on our check for quite some time and didn't even bother to finish our food because all of it, was not to our liking. 
Wishing the check would come so we can just go to In n Out
I've been coming here my whole life. The zaru soba is good. The sushi used to be better. But I'll keep coming here because I have a place in heart for it.

Been coming here since the 1980's...
Back again 2017..
Outstanding
Great to get away from the Strip!

The restaurant looked nice with exception to the brown water stain around the air conditioning intake vent. It was quiet inside with the exception that the front door we sat by slammed hard and squeaked continually due to lack of repair. The shabu-shabu was extremely sweet in comparison to more authentic cuisine. It tasted almost like candy, which leads me to believe it is over-Americanized. The gas burner we were using had trouble getting re-lit. When we turned it low, it would go out and we would have to manually re-light it. For as expensive as this restaurant was, they should be using stainless steel or ceramic chopsticks. This became most apparent when a member of my party wound up with a 1/8" splinter in her finger, from the cheap wooden disposable chopsticks. 

At this point, the only redeeming quality we found to this restaurant was our waiter. Our waiter, Jared, proved himself to be one of the best waiters in the world. Despite, being incredibly stretched thin between two rooms, he was on top of all of our needs and wound up loaning us a lighter to re-light the defective burner. He was not only kind and courteous, but in the extreme emergency of needing tweezers to remove the splinter, he was able to retrieve a pair from the emergency first aid kit that he carries in his car; because no one else in the entire restaurant had any tweezers or way to help us. We didn't waste any time tipping him EXTREMELY well.
We usually order sushi for out business meetings. The food is always amazing but it takes so long to get your order. They also never put enough soy sauce in with it. But the sushi is delicious.

Went here for the first time and absolutely love! They have a HUGE menu and quality fish.  Tasteful, fresh and clean. Service was also great. Server was kind and helpful, all staff were attentive. Little pricey but definitely worth it.

We went to this small older Japanese restaurant located in an outdated strip mall about 15 minutes from Elara on 4/10/17 for lunch.  Since they have limited tables, we ended up dining in one of the tatami rooms.  The sushi and nigiri was fine but not outstanding. Had the salad with seared tuna.  Not too bad but I have had better.   Prices were reasonable for the dishes but portions were on the small side.  Service was adequate though the waiter forgot to bring the miso soup that came with the lunch and we had to remind him at the end of the meal.   Probably not on my list to revisit on our next trip to Vegas since there are many other sushi restaurants to explore.

Amazing first time (hibachi) experience! The service was superb and the entertainment was magical. I had the 18$ dollar three course meal shrimp special and it was worth every dime my friends and I spent! Can't wait to go back!

WOW!! first off.. i love the way the seating is!.. must take off shoes in a japanese feel!.. u sit on what seems to be a pillow and what u might think of going 'indian style' lol!..however!.. u pretty much can put ur feet down below.. and the table is right in ur face!.. the tables are very intimate as they are separated by a paper wall.=] love the bamboo steps to the table.. beware of holed socks.. cuz like i said, u gotta take off ur shoes lol. ahha Second of all, there are soo many menus.. i wanna say 3 menus to choose from??.. what a very large selection to chose from..! ..i tried the teriyaki beef dinner which comes with the whole salad and soup ordeal and some tempura veggie and shrimp.. our friends ordered a lot of sumthing! but it was very pleasing! and appetizing i might add!.. cannot forget the dessert!.. super huge portions.. and loved the fried plantains, the tempura ice cream!!..waiter was thee best!.. couldnt ask for better service!.. i would definitely go back..and it makes me wanna look for a restaurant similar to this in LA!.. prices r pretty good, with the fact that since its vegas they close pretty late, and its 1/2 off!..LOVe this PLACE! =]

Are you sh*ttin' me?  

Worst.  Sushi.  Ever.

May be we should have stayed away from the sashimi and nigiri.  May be when we asked about omakase and the waitress didn't know what we were talking about we should have just ordered some standard rolls off the menu.  May be they should have given us some fresh fish instead of the wretched crap they served.  May be upon seeing the dryness/lack of luster on the fish we should have just not eaten.  May be that salmon roe was in fact not from a jar. 

May be I can recover from this horrible experience to enjoy sushi once again.  May be.

But probably not anytime soon...

This was my second time eating at Osaka and my LAST!!  The first time the palce was so crowded that I could understand the slow service, but at least the waitress was attentive.  Tonight the waitress was awful, just rude.  And her behavior progressed as we explained to her how disappointed we where that she never brought us bowls for our sauces so that we could dip our sushi, my tuna stuffed jalapeno poppers took forever to bring out and that is one of the easiest items to prepare on the menu and the fastest!!!  One of my friends went up to the front and got her own bowl and the hostess brought us more water because our waitress just disappeard.  After we complained she asked if we would like a free dessert and we accepted that, but she rolled her eyes at her after we asked her if she was new.  Her english could have been better too, this is a Japanese restaurant, why would you hire an hispanic waitress whose english is mediocre????  We will not be coming back there, EVER!!  The food is good, but for service like that it's way overpriced!!

Food is usually delicious, but sometimes the miso soup is watery & bland. Main reason for the 3 star rating is that the restaurant decor is in bad need of a renovation. It's old, outdated and doesn't reflect greatly the quality food. My wife complains of a smell in the resturant. I smell it too, but I think its the tanks gir the live seafood. It wouldnt hurt to vent that smell outside the dining area, it isn't appetizing. Now the mens bathroom is similar to dirty roadside gas stations, that's not cleaned as if your own family/young children were using it daily. That usually steers me right away from any resturant, but the food has been quality & I've watched the sushi chefs like a hawk while seated at the bar in front of them. They are clean & good at their craft. I'd go more often if they'd invest a little to freshen up the whole "little" resturant. It wouldn't take much.

Went here for my husbands birthday dinner (my first time here his second) and it was so good! 
Ordered:

App. = Yakitori, tender chicken but the sauce was a little bland. Not awsome but not bad, meh.

Sushi
Oh my God = wish I had gotten just this and the Cajun Crunch so that I could have eaten more of them before getting full. Will come back just for those next time.

Cajun Crunch = a little kick but not overwhelming heat. I could taste all the ingredients not just the spicy sauce so I was happy. 

777 roll = if it wasn't for the 2 rolls listed above this would be my favorite. Did not over do it on the cream cheese and the sauce really worked well with the mild fish.

Fire Roll = good but not great, won't get it again in favor of other rolls.

Katie Maki = tasty and a little different from what I'm used too (haven't had a roll with mushroom in it before) but I would have liked a little more shiitake in there as it was a little hard to differentiate the flavor.

Yum Yum Roll = Hubby said this was his favorite from his previous trip so we ordered a whole roll (got half rolls of some of the above so we could try more) so when it came I was excited to try it. I was underwhelmed. It was fine, just a simple plain roll but compared to the other yummies on the table I didn't want to spare valuable stomach space on it. After a couple of pieces hubby did say that he must have remebered wrong about this roll. 

Green Tea Mochi Ice Cream = I had no room for dessert but hubby had this and pronounced it "so tasty". 

Our dining compainions don't do sushi so they got the terriyaki chicken and shirmp tempura and deemed them delecious.

I was a little nervous going in after reading reviews on here about bad service but I couldn't have been happier with our service. Plates were cleared quickly and drink were kept full and we felt well taken care of. 

We will be back for sushi numminess soon.

I put one star because I had too. The manager / owner and he was also the bartender. Was very rude unprofessional and have a problem with African Americans. The hostess said our table was ready but once the last person comes we will be seated. Once we all were there and saw us. She walked right by us with people. We Did not get a chance to eat because our table was given away after five minutes to accommodate another party. Manager and bus boy very confrontational. When asking questions about our reservation he got very irate and just wanted to kick us out.

Osaka's a Las Vegas classic.  It's been around since before it was fashionable to do this whole sushi thing.  

Housed in an older building and older section of the city, the restaurant ambles backward in odd angles, but it provides for different seating areas.  Up front is the sushi bar and traditional table seating, in the middle are Teppan grills, and in the rear are Tatami rooms. 

Everything at Osaka is always delicious.  The fish is always fresh and looks appetizing.  I had some of the best tempura of my life here.  The chefs are very accommodating with special requests.  Once I attended a birthday party here with at least 20 - 25 people in attendance, all of whom were coming and going at different times, and the service was great.  Everything was prepared correctly and everyone's separated bills were correct as well.

It might not have the pomp and circumstance that other newer sushi bistros do, but Osaka is a safe bet for delicious, fresh food in a comfortable environment with superb service.

After my second satisfying visit, I decided this establishment was worthy of a review. The first time I came here with a friend I got sushi rolls and she got beef teriyaki. Both were delicious and the meals came out to about $30 for both, very reasonable for what we got!
I came here with a few more friends this time, trying out their 10-2 late night specials. I loved the half rolls so we can try out a bunch of different rolls. The tempura ice cream dessert was to die for! I suggest this place for anyone who wants a late night snack.

The parking lot is tiny (but at night you can use the neighbor lot since the stores are closed). Once you walk in it looks like a sushi restaurant with a sushi bar. Then you walk through to the 2 grills and the more private oriental style tables. In the next room is regular tables. The 2 grills use 2 different chefs, facing opposite directions. While we were eating we were watching the other chef in action. Our chef was funny, both chefs had prank tricks, and the food was some of the freshest tasting japanese food I've ever tasted. The fried rice was amazing, the chicken and shrimp were perfectly seasoned, the salad dressing was perfect, BUT the miso soup was...eh. Will definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas.

The food is average, nothing special =\ The person controlling the music wasn't soo good a lot of stop and play. One of the waitress was careless & just was like yea yea. The names on the menu was cool something different but that's about it =T

Osaka Japanese Bistro is the 

When I moved to Vegas 6 years ago, I missed the sushi culture that I had experienced living on the central coast CA my whole life.

I found out about Osaka Japanese Bistro when a local friend brought me to Happy Hour and I fell in love the minute I walked in.

They remember me and know what I order each time I dine here and they have amazing lunch and late night dinner specials.


Also,  I love all of Osaka's specials they treat to their locals.  Free sake every day for Happy Hour 4:30-7:00pm, buy a T-shirt and receive a free large sake and wear it into Osaka each time you eat and receive a free large sake.

They are open everyday from 11-2am & Osaka even have a VIP card for returning customers who get 10% of their check placed on a voucher for your next party

We went here with a big group on a Friday night, a group of 15. There was no wait and the servers were friendly although it took them hella long to get our order even though all of our table was seated. Anyways we ordered beers and sake and we were gonna try the sake sampler nigori flight, but I was told it was super small and not worth it by a friend who had been there before. Anyways for our big group we ordered 3 large boats for 55$ each. I was like whatever because we were with a group but really I am Asian and this deal was the shittiest deal ever. 
For 55$ you get 2 half or age slices (so basically 1 whole orange) 15 slices of crappy beef/steak that had no flavor except the teriyaki sauce they dumped onto it. And the chicken looked dry and freeze dried and was absolutely horrible. Also this 55$ boat came with 7 pieces of sushi. I thought it was gonna be at least nigiri but it was actually 2 pieces of salmon, 2 tuna, 2 white albacore and a shitty shittay flavorless imitation California roll.
What a disappointment!!! I am so accustomed to have lots of sushi and nigiri and oh the best part of the boat was the tempura. Kinda oily but sadly the best part.
I would come here again because I had fun with friends but the food was quite Terrible. We also ordered the Kalbi skewers and it wasn't Kalbi it was more like bi-bim-bap on a stick. Also the steak roll were terrible and dry. And the best thing was the sappo roll. Tasty refreshing and real fish. 
The only thing that made this tolerable was the large Sapporo and sake.
Ps my friend said the Cole slaw was good. 
And also I asked for extra ginger an hour ago and it never came.
See attached piece of chicken. It was freeze dried and no one ate it because it looked like rubbery dried intestines.

Well, I must say I was quite hesitant when we saw the place. It is in a cheap strip mall surrounded by 'exotic' shoe and dance wear stores. Very unassuming decor and a very small seating area..but.......The food is amazing!! I have not had sushi this good in a very, very long time.Tough to get fresh fish in Vegas but this place manages to deliver an amazing meal.
Enjoyed watching Chef make our rolls.
Sadly the reason for the 4 stars: The servers were sloooooow. It took a long time for them to bring our  drinks and refills. Thankfully we sat at the sushi bar so were served our food immediately from Chef. I will go again.

Found this place and Yelp and came here for some Zaru Udon. It was the only place open super late on a Thursday night that didn't sound too pricey.

I ordered the zaru somen since they ended up not having the zaru udon after all. Ialso got the Virgin roll and my husband got beef yaki soba. 

The roll was delicious but the problem I had is they messed up both our orders. They gave me some weird udon chicken soup and my husband this chicken stew with onions. At first, I didn't know what to do since I've never had mine let alone both our orders messed up beyond reason.

I don't like complaining to waiters usually so we just dealt with it. I did end up telling our female waiter both our orders got messed up and all she said was, "oh" and walked off. 

I honestly would return here because the sushi was delicious but I'm still disappointed how much they fucked up our order.

I went out to Osaka (again) tonight.  I've been going for 35 years.  This was, literally, the BEST meal I have ever had!  The Pocket Ace roll was the most incredible combination of flavors--each bit from each roll we ordered was better then the last.  The menu is always changing, so it is 'new' all the time.  I am normally disappointed with desserts in Asian restaurants, but the ice cream filled fried pound cake was delicate, crispy and sweet.  I loved the fresh blueberries on top.  I've been to restaurants much pricier, but never better!

I was recommended to come to this delicious Japanese place while on my visit to Las Vegas. We tried the Japanese lasagne, bacon wrapped asparagus, and other traditional sushi rolls. I visited this location with my family and it is very family oriented. Wonderful friendly service and fresh food. Can't wait to come back. Definitely a must try at least once.

I freaking love Osaka.

No joke - I call them for a pick-up order, and they're like, "Evelyn, is that you?"  An intervention may be in order...

At any rate, if you love sushi, check out Osaka.  They're not the cheapest place in town, but it's still better than the strip.  This is no AYCE hack joint; but you can order half-rolls and go to town with the variety - they also have a decent happy hour/late night menu.  

My favorites are the Oh Kamis

Osaka is easily one of the most civilized sushi restaurants in Vegas, and it's my "default" sushi spot.

I have come to thoroughly dislike the multitude of "fusion" sushi joints cropping up all over town. The majority of them are owned by Koreans and have little in common with traditional Japanese food.

Thankfully, Osaka is an oasis here in the Mojave desert. Having been around for more than 40 years, they were doing traditional sushi long before it has hip or trendy. And they've stuck with a traditional approach, relying on top-quality ingredients and skilled chefs.  The owner told me he gets his fish from the same supplier as Nobu and they often split a fish between the two restaurants. To the sushi snob, the difference is apparent. 

As wonderful as the food is, the dining experience is what really sets Osaka apart. From the coziness of the sushi bar to the tranquility of the tatami rooms, Osaka offers the most civilized dining experience I've encountered so far. No blaring hip hop, no trendy decor, no pushy servers, just an hour or two of peace and tranquility to enjoy good quality food. It's like Zen meditation with raw fish. Divine.

The BEST EVER!!! from the waiter..David..who brought be stuff he thought I'd like to the food!! My WHOLE meal was WONDERFUL!! had the ume handroll which had a special adding to it..NEVER had one that was better!! And had the curry udon..no doubt the BEST udon EVER!!! SooO awesome Japanese restaurant!! Next time I'll sit in the back thats like authentic Japanese eating! LOVE this place..I'll be back!!

My top choice for sushi in Vegas.  I've visited 2 locations in Vegas, but the Henderson location feels like home.  They are quick to learn your name and the staff couldn't be any nicer!  Try the 777 Roll!

BEST Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas.  The food and service is 5 Stars.  The servers (Mike and Jared) are very attentive and knowledgeable.   If your in Las Vegas give it try, you won't be disappointed.

Quite possibly the best nigiri I've had.  It's clear that they know their fish and provide great quality.  The 12 piece chef's choice nigiri was a great value at $35, with excellent amaebi, uni, toro etc.  Well over $35 worth of sushi and every piece was great quality.  Even the beef teriyaki that my 7 year old nephew had received excellent reviews from everyone at the table due to the quality of the meat.    The service of the staff lived up to the quality of the food as well.
If you're visiting the strip and want some great Japanese food, avoid the crowds and head a couple miles west on Sahara to Osaka.  I'll be going every time I'm in town.

The prices are the only thing keeping this place from being 5 stars...and maybe for some the location.  It has a weird entrance that is a brick wall hallway that you walk around to get in the actual restaurant , and outside it is surrounded by  sinful shops - but thats vegas!

I had the Japanese Lasagna roll (8 pieces for $7.95) which if you like creamy flavors is really awesome and probably one of the best values on the menu.  I asked about happy hour and it is just at the sushi bar from 4-6 PM.  I thought it was odd that no one was at the bar so I'm guessing the happy hour menu isn't so great but I don't know.

I split the Rock shrimp salad (one medium plate for $12 I think) and it was pretty good, not great.  The shrimp were kind of bland but the sauce was good - and the salad portion was just iceberg lettuce and a few carrots.

My date had the Jalapeno Tuna sushi special of the day (8 small pieces for $18) which she said was great.  She also had a half roll of the Dynamite roll I think (4 pieces for $7)  which was a shrimp roll with crunchy flakes on top.  I had a bite and it was well flavored but a bit hard to discern the flavors because of the crunchy/dry stuff they put on it.  

Service was good and the coolest thing about this places is the intimate booths that are old school Japanese style where you take your shoes off and sit on the floor (there is a place to put your legs under the table however), but this might get uncomfortable for a some during a long dinner.

Pretty terrible quality of raw fish and uni. Its the same as what you get at all-you-can-eat sushi - but more expensive. 2stars. Firm.

However, late night special is cheap. If you are drunk and wanna fill up your stomach, this place is ok. I give 3 stars for the late night special.

Only good thing about it is the location. It's near the Strip.

Love this place! I've never tried anything I didn't like here. They have lunch and late night specials. I go about once a week and enjoy the Japanese tatami style tables. The employees are all very kind and attentive as well!

This is our go-to sushi spot in the city. We're usually going with a big group (10-20 people), and they've always been VERY accommodating. The sunken tables (tatami rooms?) with legroom underneath are great for big groups, allowing a little privacy, and the service is always pretty good. Good house sake, standard Japanese beers.

I wouldn't say it's the best sushi I've ever had, but it's up there enough to keep us coming back. And it's certainly been consistent in my experience.

Was greeted, seated and served all within a timely period. Had kitsune udon soup with marinated tofu and some kind of fish broth. Helped after a long exhausting trip to Vegas. At the end tried green tea tiramisu, pricey but most worth it.

They have eating area (I was starving so just stayed there cause it was empty) and Japanese rooms. On right side they have stylish sit-down counter where you can watch them prepare sushi. 

Next time will try more of their dishes when not as tired.

LISA LISA IS THE BOMB. Just saying. So my sister and I came here with our Dad, he had been living in Las Vegas for about a year, and he wanted to show us what good 'Las Vegas sushi' tasted like. I was skeptical. I mean, Las Vegas is a freakin' desert so I didn't expect the sushi to be as impeccable as we have it here in the city by the bay. Nicky B is a pretty foolish kid. 

We walked in and I was immediately amazed with all the cool-futuristic-tables and high definition televisions that played menu items over and over again. We sat down at the sushi bar. Our sushi-chef was really nice. My dad knew him, so we he talked to us about stuff. Pretty cool. Then comes the food. I take a bite. I'm blown away! Wow. It was incredible. Tasty. Ahhh. Lisa Lisa I love you. Try it ya'll. You'll fall in love too.

Came to Osaka really late during my trip out to Vegas to check out the happy hour with some friends, and saw this place had great reviews.  We certainly didn't have a terrible experience, but I can't say I'd come here again.

I got a California Roll, chicken wings and shared a Japanese Burger sushi which was weirdly unique but tasted pretty good.  The California roll tasted odd, I'm not sure if the avocado was in the best shape, but it was alright.  The chicken wings were cool too, and we also shared some edamame.

But the prime reason I'm giving this place 1 star is the price.  This place is ridiculously expensive.  Even a plain 6-piece cucumber roll was $4.  You can get that other places for a buck.  And this was happy hour! 

I can get way better sushi for a fraction of cost elsewhere.  No thanks, Osaka.

Osaka's used to be really good.  My last two trips were disappointing because the sushi rice tasted odd.

My previous trips to Osaka's were great.  The spicy scallop hand rolls were fantastic.

The price is a little steep, to say the least.  The service is great if they're not busy.

Came in for a birthday at the teppanyaki grill area with a group of 6. Great cook with a great show. Had the fish and veggies entree. Honestly never had a better fish and veggies dinner. Thank you!! Loved it!!

I held high expectations of this place due the the praise it had been given by multiple reviewers. But I was throughly disappointed. When I walked in and was lost I walked out one of the servers chased after me to not go out the door bc it would set off an alarm. Thus begins the terrible service from the wait staff. They told me to just walk in even though I had no clue where I was going and were pushy. When I got done and settle with my friends to eat they got my order wrong twice. When I did receive my sashimi I had been disappointed by the size portion and the taste of one of the tunas made my tongue roll over and die. If you are going to serve sashimi at least make it fresh. The waiters were extremely confused when bringing out our dishes and slightly unprofessional where I literally thought they were all high. When it came time for the check I was very angry they included gratuity because the food was mediocre and the service was terrible save for just one waiter. You are better off avoiding this place.

I was really excited to try this place after seeing it on Diners, Drive-Ins, ad Dives. We were promptly greeted and seated. The server was very polite and courteous. We ordered, I had the OG Special and my husband ordered chicken fried rice, we also had steamed gyoza. The gyoza was awesome, and the fried rice was really good. We like a little more egg in our fried rice than most so it was perfect for us. My roll was interesting. The rice is crispy like it was grilled or something, which I wasn't expecting because I didn't completely read the description. It was really good, you just have to get passed the square shape, heated, crispyness. As we were getting our food a large party showed up and they got all of the attention. We ran out of water and waited over 20 minutes for a server to bring us our check so we could leave. We would have asked sooner if we had seen them but they were lost in the back with the huge party. Very unfortunate for a place with such outstanding reviews.

This location is my favorite...yes its a older building but the tunami rooms are awesome :-) I love slipping off my shoes and slidding into the tunami booths. Something about the cozy intamate booth munching on good food while sipping on some plum wine....sigh* it just puts me in my happy place :-) and for you parents out their with toddlers...the tunami rooms are perfect for little ones (like mine) that do not like sitting still and being in high chairs :-D they are able to move more and stand while eating while keeping them nicely contained ;-) you can actually have a nice meal without chasing around your little cuteness!!

Ohhh I got the regular badge from here :-) That excited me.

This place is really good. I'm a sushi aficionado. I try to visit as many high rated local places in town. Frankly Osaka is REALLY far from my house but it's close to my surgeon's office. So where did we go for lunch after my two post op appointments? 


... You got it!

They give you the option of Teppanyaki, Sushi bar or the traditional Japanese seating on the floor with big fun fluffy pillows!

I love their lunch menu. They offer low priced high quality half rolls. We ordered a bunch! 

007 Roll - $8.95
Shrimp tempura roll topped with spicy tuna

Citrus Lemon Salmon - $6.50
Salmon with lemon and salt

We ordered a few more with unusual names but they were all amazing and fresh. They also have an amazing Saki selection:

Nagasaki Mandarin Infused - $22.00/btl
Ginjo Ty Ku - $13.00/gl, $48/btl
Tozai "Living Jewel" Unfiltered - $15.00/btl
Daiginjo Ultra Premium Horim - $26.00/btl
Daiginjo Ultra Premium Hakatsuru - $12.00/gl, $46.00/btl
Otokoyama Junmai - $11.00/gl, $20.00/btl
Momokawa Genshu "G-Joy" - $18.00/btl
Nigori Murai - $12.00/gl, $46.00/btl
Nigori Tozai - $15.00/btl


We will be returning!

Really like the decor and seating arrangements, you feel like in a private upscale restaurant. The sushi rolls are quite good, however the small dishes such as teriyaki/udon/etc are overpriced and not impressive.

Good for late night sushi and drinking session but who wants to drive so far from the strip?

Went here with a big group of girls. First loved the traditional seating. We got a ton of rolls and the lychee sake. It was all very good!

Not a single roll I did not like. The fish was fresh and the variety on the menu was great.

For dessert, go with the classic -tempura fried ice cream.

I think it's very sad when the TV commercial says "food prepared by professional Japanese chefs" in the picture shows some white guy chef flipping some food to a Japanese family. Fortunately the food wasn't as awful as that stupid commercial. When we were there my chef couldn't even speak a word of Japanese. I think most Japanese chefs know a little bit of Japanese because of their family origin.

Loved it!!!!  Saw it on DDD and it was well worth the trip off the strip.  We had the Roppongi, Oh Kamisama, and White Tiger rolls.  We also had the Blue Fin Tuna, Skipjack, Thai Hamachi and Special Tai nigiri.  Everything was amazing and super fresh!  We will definitely be back!

Osaka has been a long standing Japanese Restaurant in the valley...I can only say it was Ok for me.

It's been many years since my last visit to Osaka Japanese Bistro on Sahara, but on this windy night, I came here with my girl friend in preparation for her upcoming trip to Osaka, Japan, as she wanted to try Okonomi Yaki.  

Also we ordered 
- Tako Wasabi
- Chirashi 
- Tokujo Nigiri: 12 pcs of nigiri Chef's choice 

My favorite was Tako Wasabi...fresh and crunchy. The Chirashi had so much rice in the bowl, but was also packed with fresh cuts of fish which we enjoyed...unlike the nigiri, that seemed to all be dry and bland.

Service was excellent...they never stop filling our cups with hot tea and water.  

Unfortunately for Osaka Japanese Bistro, Vegas has so much competition for sushi lovers, and Osaka stands as just average for me.

-2017 review #30-

I was extremely disappointed. I did have my food delivered, so i guess I  missed out on the dining experience of the actual resteraunt which, from the photos, looks nice. 

 I ordered the soft shell crab, shrimp tempura, firecracker shrimp, korean kalbi short ribs, and fried tofu. In total my order cost over $70.00. For that price I expect deliciousness; what I got was buyer's remorse. 

The food arrived cold. Disappointingly included in my order was one small box of white rice and three containers of what had to be miso soup (which i did not order) but NO teriyaki, ponzu, or any kind of dipping sauce. I ate my tempura dry. The korean short ribs were so incredibly chewy I spat them out. The fried tofu was soggy and bland with a few spring onions thrown in the box. The softshell crab was dry with no flavor. It came with a cream sauce that was extremely runny compared to similar sauces I've had. The only redeeming dish was the firecracker shrimp - it was seasoned well, the texture was great, and it had just enough spice to make it tasty with a kick.

Overall the food was bland, dry, sloppily packaged for delivery, and a huge let down. I would not recommend.

Mixed feelings about this place.  The building is kinda weird.  You walk in through he sushi bar room to get to the hostess station.  So, if you're sitting in the sushi bar room, which is small, everyone walks by you.  The room had adequate lighting but looked aged.  There is a breeze coming from the vents that would blow for a while and then stop and start and stop.  
Appetizers we got gyoza, kalbi sticks, spring rolls.  We did not like any of the appetizers.  Kalbi didn't have any carmelization and lacked the flavor I expect.  Spring rolls where real small and didn't have much filling.  gyoza were small with a thin shell and appeared to be deep fried, so there were crispy all around.  We're used to them being fried on one side and steamed on one side.  

We got a roll sampler that had spicy tuna, las vegas roll, cal roll and a shrimp tempura roll.  Rolls were meh, just okay.  Don't think I would order those again.  

Then we ordered salmon, yellowtail, and smoked salmon nigiri along with a futomaki roll.  The nigiri was good.  The futomaki roll appeared to have been refrigerated.  Seaweed was a little hard and the rice was cold.  

I think if we only got nigiri, this place could have been a 4 star, but with what we got, 2 stars is about all I can give

Eh ...

Okay, I'll start with the good:  The ambiance and service was great.  They have those low tables, where you take your shoes off and/or sit cross-legged.  Our server was very friendly and hospitable.

The so-so: The food was okay.  I had tempura vegetable Udon soup and a side of vegetable rolls.  The tempura vegetable was good.  The Udon soup and vegetable rolls were okay.  The BF had curry rice.  I tasted the curry, and it was good.  The BF said the chicken was pretty good.  His Sister had Soba noodles.  I'm not a big fan of these noodles, but it she appeared to enjoy it.  I also had a melon soda, which was really good!  It has a marble in the drink, which is entertaining for little kids.

The bad:  The price was a little steep for an average Japanese restaurant.  It came out to $30 a person.  The pitcher of beer also has a large cone in the middle of it so that you don't get as much beer as you think you're getting.

Helpful hint:  They have a point card for those frequent patrons.

Overall, I wouldn't object to going here again, but it's not my first choice.
Really good sushi, the chefs where really friendly and fast. Disappointed there was no all you can eat. But still had a great time.

Extraordinary sushi! We tried the 777, the Kamakaze, and the Oh Kamisama all featured on their late night menu. YUMMMMM! The service was also excellent. We ate at the sushi bar and had speedy and friendly service. So glad to have found this spot!
Would not visit again!!! The cook for our grill was very nice, but that did not make the rice taste any 'nicer'!
Saw this was on Diners, Dives, and Drives. I frequent Vegas quite a bit, so, had to make a stop here! It was really good! Will definitely make a return back!

Today was my birthday and my children decided to take me to the Osaka Japanese restaurant on Sahara. We sat down excited about the fun of celebrating, expecting an entertaining chef. Instead we had to endure watching a chef struggle through preparing our dinner. He was totally unsure of himself and acted very confused. He kept dropping the utensils then bending down to pick them up off the floor, proceeding to wipe  them off with a wet towel...then reusing them. He could only prepare one item at a time and it was so stressful to watch. His knife skills were a d- at best. Not to mention that he brought out two pieces of meat, with one looking fresh and the other looking brown and old.  My daughter asked him about the color of the meat and he said it was fine. Then he offered to cover it in teriyaki sauce to improve the bad smell and taste. My daughter had to excuse herself to the restroom because she felt nauseous knowing it would make her sick if she ate that steak. I then told the very nice waiter what was going on and he explained we were the first people he had prepared a meal for. I said that the chef told us he had been working there twelve years. He said, yes, that was true....but he was working there in other jobs like bussing tables.
I could go on about this negative experience but must stop with this final thought...I just do not understand and it is beyond me how they could let an untrained incompetent person play chef at the expense of their unsuspecting customers. Very disappointed!
Really fresh sake. Great rolls. Nice option to get a half or a full roll. Delicious lychee sake. Fast service. Amazing!

Being from Hawaii I'm  familiar with good Japanese food. I had the shrimp tempura and chicken combo. It came with 4 large shrimp 2 carrots 1 zucchini and onion ring. Tempura batter was light and crispy. On par with the best tempura I've had. The teriyaki chicken came with a light tasting teriyaki sauce. Pleasant and not over powering. My wife had the pork tofu. The broth was excellent. It had a good portion of pork but lacked enough tofu. And the dish was over powered by an over abundance of onion. The price of the entrees was reasonable.

This place is super cool considering it's in Vegas.

Japanese style tables, a sushi bar, and some pretty shockingly good food that's reasonably priced for it's proximity to the strip.

Don't expect anyone to know where this is if you're taking a cab.  Bring an address and have mapped it out first.

I thought that it was an abandoned building from the outside, but after entering through the air conditioning airlock, it was business as usual on the inside.

This may be my second favorite secret japanese place for when I'm in town.
Excellent Sushi. Like that you can get 1/2 rolls or full rolls. For 2 of us the bill cam to over $90.00 this included 1 small sake & a beer plus green tea tempura ice cream.

AR is one of the best servers.  He remembered my husband from a year later. He even changed the tv so that we could watch the Raider game. I hope that he will be there is March 2016. The next time I will be there.

Customer service here is great. A couple of weeks ago I brought in a friend who knew nothing about sushi. He ordered a few rolls including the salmon roll and when it was brought out he said I can't eat this because it is raw. I then told him that the fish in sushi is raw unless specified otherwise. The waiter came around and could tell he hadn't touched it and asked if something was wrong. He said yeah I just really didn't know it was raw and the waiter laughed and said no problem I will take it off the bill. First off it was my friends fault and I am not used to Asian people who work at restaurants having good customer service.

My usual order here is the miso cod and the cucumber salad with crab. Both dishes are executed well. The miso cod is both tender and flakey and the crab salad has a refreshing flavor that pairs well with the miso cod.

My girlfriend and I ate here for dinner last night and it was nothing short of amazing. 

We had a reservation for 8 but, with traffic on the east side, we made it around 8:15 and they still sat us right away around the Teppan bar. The young man got us our drinks speedy quick but still gave us time to look at the menu. 

I got the Chicken and NY with the Calamari Steak appetizer and a 911(spicy, spicy tuna) roll and half a California. While my girlfriend got the Chicken and Shrimp and Calamari Steak as well. It was about 3 minutes from when he left our table that we had already gotten our soup and salad, delicious. 

When our chef came out, he seemed quiet at first but then really started interacting with my girlfriend and I as the night progressed. I won't get too much into his routine because I feel like that's something special everyone should see but it was very cool. 

My steak and chicken were perfectly cooked along with the friend rice and the Calamari Steak, tasted very authentic. The Sushi was delicious, not too crazy but not too plain, I loved every bite. 

Our tab came out to 112.28 after our $20 tip, not bad considering how much food we got and the amazing service. Came here for our birthday dinner and was fulfilled in every single way. We will come here again with an empty stomach and a big smile :)

First Time there and what made us go was the GroupOn Special.. but needless To Say we had The Best Service There and the Staff was Awsome!!Big Thank You To Sonny and our waitress and The Manager was great
My friends and I go here all the time, sushi is awesome. Everyone is super friendly. And the desserts are the bomb!

This place is filthy. We are sitting in the back at a booth and the space next to the wall is an inch thick in dirt. The place in general in unkempt. 
The food was fair but 4 rolls and they all tasted the same.

Stopped here on a whim, and was very pleased. We sat at the bar, and didn't even know how big the restaurant was. Great service and food- and let me just say- there is nothing wrong about the "something wrong" dish!! YUM!

Another must-eat during our Vegas culinary adventures.  Almost always accommodating (no wait) for this quiet haven of quality food!!  The soft shell crab appetizers are a winner and almost anything else will not disappoint!!

I always past by this place on Sahara so I decided to finally try it, been there forever so it must be good. Thankfully it was, if there was a standard for authenticity it would be this place. Felt like I was actually in Japan! I ordered the tiger roll and the sassy roll. The fish is fresh which is the reason why the rolls are so expensive. They do not have AYCE but the rolls are decent. If you are in the mid for AYCE this is not the place you want to go. 

Their service is great! The ambiance is amazing also, the tables are set like traditional Japanese tables where you sit on your knees and eat. Now if that's not your thing the table are dug in underneath so you can sit like you are at a normal table. All in all a defined must come/go. Food is good and the service is great!

I love everything about this place, such as sushi, combination plate, and love the plum wine. 
Great customer service and good food

2 words,
JAPANESE LASAGNA!!!!!!!
BEST IN TOWN!!!!
i love this place, i love the seating and customer service!
the sushi has never been bad here and ive always been in a great full mood when we leave.

This place is so delicious! I am a regular & most of the time they all ready know my order, their spicy edamame is to die for. Their service is also great. I enjoy this place a lot, highly recommend it.

Honestly a pretty average Japanese restaurant. Vegas has some great chocked when it comes to this cuisine, some offering outstanding quality while others with great deals and Happy Hours. We came after 10pm to take advantage of the late night menu here, but it was still pretty expensive for rolls. They came out extremely fast however, as if it was cooked in a race. Honestly it was too fast, like we ordered two rolls and less than 5 minutes later we were bested by them. And then our appetizer took a good 20 minutes. So their timing needs to be worked on. They also had hit sake for $5 for late night, but no cold sake which is always very interesting to me. All in all, the sushi was ok, the service was slow to take our order but extremely fast to produce (at least the sushi), and the venue was nicer inside than the area appears. But I would try another great Vegas sushi place instead unless this is simply next on your list.

I'm shocked by the negative reviews... I've been going to this restaurant for over 2 years and I have never had a bad experience. The sushi is always fresh, the service is great and I love the traditional seating. I will agree that the look from the outside and when first entering is a lil sketchy but it also gives it a lil character. This is the go-to spot for a midweek treat. I highly recommend the Omg roll. I crave it monthly.

Came in expecting a 4 star sushi joint ... Coming from the California coast maybe my expectations were too high but ... Cali crunch roll was similar to the sushi at albertsons  which I won't eat ... Veggie tempura so soaked in grease ... Miso soup lacked favor , watery and plain ... Apologized after one bite and maybe half a cup of soup that I can't eat any of this ... And was told to pay for both the tempura and soup ... Highly disappointed and a lesson learned . Blows my mind this place is in business .

This was our first visit to the HENDERSON LOCATION. So, the other location in Summerlin may be better. 

My wife and I ate here as members of a birthday celebration. When the reservations were for 6 people, and 7 showed up, they treated it as if it was a great inconvenience. Prior to being seated for dinner, we had to wait quite a while to get drinks. And even then they were out of a few beers. The waitress was not a bartender by any means. She was confused about the ingredients of basic cocktails. 

The manager, who sits at the front door was in no way accommodating or friendly. We did not feel welcomed or comfortable upon our arrival. Perhaps it was the additional member of our party that upset him. We felt as if we were an inconvenience. 

That being said, the food was good. We had the combination dinner with steak and seafood. The preparation and presentation were really nice. Our chef was humorous and entertaining. The food was hot and flavorful. The sauces were outstanding.

So, we were happy with the food and unhappy with the hospitality. That being said, we will try it again and hope we our experience will be better. Worth giving it a try!

I love this place! I've been twice. They have an extensive menu.. tons of rolls... lots of specials (I always opt for their sashimi). Everything is fresh. They have great fresh wasabi too. The prices are so much better than most places in town and they're attentive and super nice. They also offer a cucumber wrapped Rock & Roll roll- if you're watching carbs.

A fun & funky place to bring friends and family!! Every time I step into this restaurant it makes me smile to be seated either on the floor or in one of the sunken booths. There's a great atmosphere shared by all. 

I was with some sushi newbies, so we didn't venture out too far meal wise on this visit- although they offer quite the creative mix of rolls. I can't wait to try their Treasure Island - complete with capers and sliced onions and the El Pollo Loco, with chicken, asparagus and Japanese salsa! Say What?! That is my kind of loco! 

For this occasion, we ordered:
*Spicy tuna - a solid basic
*Ribeye wrapped around asparagus - meat was on the tough side, with a flavorful sauce and succulent asparagus. Just an okay dish.
*Chicken nuggets - the kiddo and big kiddos chowed down on these little nuggets 
*Fresh White roll - My favorite roll of the night! Fresh, juicy albacore with hamachi, shaved radish, cucumber and wrapped in soy pap. It was delicate yet hearty.
*Kai's Special roll - had some kick.
*Lisa Lisa roll - this was kind of a standard, and our table's favorite. How can one go wrong with shrimp tempura done right?

Service has always been wonderful here, I can't think of one occasion where we didn't receive a greeting, smiles, a quick seat, explanations to questions, help ordering for anyone at the table, quick refills, sake flowing; it's all good. In addition to their funky rolls, they offer Special Boats that are quite a feast to the eyes. If you are looking to make an impression on someone, I'd say that's a sure bet. Then there is the Shabu Shabu, Sukiyaki or Yosenabe to try for yet more adventurous options. Life is good here; Adventure on!!

This is the oldest Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas.  We came here at the recommendation of DDD.  Not a disappointment at all.  You take off your shoes to sit down...we loved it.  On weekends they are open until 2 am and have a late night menu that is very good and reasonable.  Sushi rolls, tempura shrimp and vegetables, teriyaki chicken all good.  If you have a large group I would recommend reservations.  Be sure to ask for Rudy.  He is the bomb!!  This is a place all must try.

The OMG roll was just that! And the Kamisama roll was great yummo!!
Also, the service was professional and courteous. Definitely recommend this one to all foodies and kid-friendly too!

Went to Osaka tonight for something lighter after a heavy lunch. Chose it as part of a DDD food adventure while in Vegas. Outside is nothing much to look at but inside is quite authentic and the staff, especially Jared, were fantastic. Thought the prices were very reasonable. 

Went with a couple of standards as a baseline and a few of Jared's recommendations. Everything was very good but the special cucumber salad, spicy garlic edamame and roppongi roll were top of the list. Delicious. Wish we had more time so we could go back. Might have to skip something else so we can. Thoroughly enjoyed it.

I come here every time I'm in town. It used to be one of the best Sushi places period. Always loved this place and recommended it to friends whenever someone was visiting. Yesterday I went, and for the first time was disappoint. The rolls just aren't as good as they used to be. Way too much rice and not enough fish. Plus the individual pieces were almost falling apart. I'm also not a fan of the fact that out of the four sushi chefs only one is actually Japanese. 
What a shame.

This place was decent. 
I came here for the first time tonight, I ordered the following:
Hot green tea
1/2 911 roll 
O.G roll
Spicy edamame 
Miso soup.

911 roll wasn't spicy like I was hoping but still pretty good, and the OG roll had good flavors but I think mine was burnt because it was tough to chew. 
The spicy edamame was undercooked and weird. Couldn't finish it.
Miso soup was good, and my green tea never stayed empty for long.
I'll come back for non sushi items next time because the sushi is over priced for the quality you're getting.
Love the tatami mat sections. The carpet is old and needs to be replaced and the bathroom was pretty much out of soap.

The service was great but the rest was mediocre.
I'll try it again though because I want to like it.

Hands down, the absolute BEST Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas! The best sushi I ever had! You can't beat this place. This is what all Japanese restaurants should be measured against. I love this place and can't wait for my next trip to Vegas to go here!

I ordered a take out of about 4 sushis rolls and they were all delicious ! I had the Crunchy Tako, The White Tiger, The Virgin and the Pollo Loco. The customer service was also delightful, the servers kept on offering me water while waiting for my order. Very nice place !

Hamachi Sashimi - Perfect. Tender. Fresh.

Uni Sushi - Very fresh. Not too slimy. Melts in your mouth.

Asakusa Rolls - Spicy tina topped with albacore and scallions, tataki sauce on top - The spice level was good but it was missing that extra kick. The tuna was good..The roll just didn't have anything that stood out.

Osaka Rice - mixture of sushi rice, crab, masago, mayo, sesame oil, and sriracha - Sooooo much yumminess. It's like a comfort food more than anything else. Def try this.

I think it's best to stick with with the fresh sashimi and get some osaka rice to have a good meal.
Came back and tried the king and Queen steak and lobster it was yummy my favorite so far outside of Benihana even better in my opinion because I prefer cute smaller restaurants with good food ;)

I went into Osaka last night for some late night sushi with my friends. The entrance is kinda creepy, but whatever haha. We were asked if we wanted to sit at the sushi bar or in a japanese room. We chose the room. It was cool because the room is really big and you get cushions to sit on, and you take your shoes off.

That's about the most exciting thing I can say for this place. The service was just alright. There were like 8 people in the whole restaurant and it took them almost an hour to bring 3 sushi rolls. They barely came by to see how we were doing, just seemed like they wanted us to leave. 

The rolls were also kind of pricey, even being half off. They were alright, though. The fried banana was really good. I wouldn't come back to this place.

This place has a true japanese feel to it. It is a small, almost divey, place. There is a room for table seating, a room for sitting with the chef as he prepares your meals and a room for good ole Japanese style seating. You remove your shoes and you sit on a pad and down low. We sat here. It was awesome. The initial server that serves you water and drinks and busses your table was a mid-aged white man who spoke very well (very educated) and it was a dismal reality check as to the stake of our economy that this professional has been reduced to busser work. Not that we don't love or need our bussers, they definitely keep the restaurant in order. I couldn't refuse the sushi. I ordered a half roll of the Asakusa (Spicy Tuna Roll topped with Albacore & Scallions) which was close to orgasmic. I ordered a standard yellowtail roll and then I checked out the rest of the entrees and found a Curry Tempura (which does not seem to be on their online menu). It was FANtastic!! Needless to say I left with happy taste buds and a loaded stomach. If I go back to Vegas I will most certainly be visiting here again.

My
Favorite sushi place!!! I LOVE these Guy's!!! Andy & Oscar are my favorite sushi bar chefs  I am so addicted I come at least once a week during lunch!!! My favorite is the OH KAMISAMA!! They have lunch specials too! Mmmmm forever a fan!

Updated to add: the whole staff here is great!!

Osaka offers three ways to dine- the sushi bar, the main dining room, and the tatami room. We went to the Sahara Location.

We had the dragon roll and few other which I don't remember the name. I thought the price was high but the sushi was melt in your mouth good. I noticed they had a special free lobster teppan dinner for your birthday with purchase of 5 teppan dinner. Definitely want to try that out.

Great food and great service. What can you say. We had awesome Sashimi and sushi and they were amazing. It was to awesome ! Good size portions and good Saki too.  Hence the 5 stars VS - 5. PS: No hot towels and no edamame and no orange with plum wine like the good old days gift. Enjoy !

We've eaten here several times since my last post and everything has been really good. When we've eaten with the live chef, he's always been extra attentive to our 3yo son. The food is still a little expensive and I've stopped asking for brown rice because they charge so much for it. Otherwise, the food it good and the take out is prepared quickly and the location is convenient for us.

This place is extremely cute! It was our first time there and we were seated at a "booth." It's the kind of place where you take off your shoes and eat. It made me feel like I was at a real restaurant in Japan. They're opened until 2 AM so my boyfriend and I came for their happy hour. They have a huge selection and we ordered a few rolls. Just FYI the happy hour rolls are smaller than their regular rolls. It was tasty and the food was fresh.

Got suckered by DDD and gave this place a try...  Featured as the very first sushi place in LV..  
I should've known better than to expect fresh sushi in a desert or trust Guy's pitch for Sushi on a show featuring Dives..
Buffet quality fish both cooked/raw
Rice to fish ratio sucked.. Same on rolls..
Gave it one more star as I know Its hard to please LA pallets on asian food out of state.

Another nightmare of a restaurant, perfect for those that think that a California Roll (poorly made) is the height of Japanese cuisine.

Rumor is that Yukio Mishima ate here before deciding to kill himself.

1. Ambience: When you first walk in, you think "hey, instead of the pretentious bs overpriced Vegas Hotel Japanese restaurant scene, I may have found one of those amazing hole-in-the-wall spots that will be a great authentic experience"...well, the hole-in-the-wall is right, and in this case, it is just that. 

The restaurant is old, dilapidated, and damn confusing to escape from. But if you check it out thoroughly, you can almost smell (um and smell other things to) that this was once a great, great place. It looks like the shell of a restaurant taken over by someone's kid or run by an owner who no longer cares whether he has a customer or not. Perhaps his dog died and he's depressed. Perhaps the dog is one of the menu items. 

In fact, when we were there, there were about 4 people in a space that could seat at least 100 or more I would think.

Then there are the prostitutes and what not that like to stop by for their pick up orders. Not the restaurant's fault but certainly, this is an inviting atmosphere for them. Funny part is that they got better service then we did.

2. Service: haahaha! What? What's service? Um. Not on the menu.

Yah, so we sat in front of the most disinterested Japanese sushi chef I have ever experienced outside of wacko Nozawa in LA. But Nozawa is at least an actor. This momo was for real. Rude attitude. Totally didn't give a shit that we were the only customers at the bar, or basically in the restaurant. He was busy in his own world. And then of course, there is the attitude driven little Yakuza wanabee waitress who looks like she needs to focus more on the Hello Kitty art on her nails, then bother with a customer.

When we asked in advance if a certain item was cooked a certain way, and were given incorrect information, they still hesitated, and gave us attitude about taking it back! I mean, we asked in advance! But its our fault that they deep fry what in any normal restaurant is grilled. Oh I speak of YAKITORI. Yes. They deep fry it here so that it has a wonderful brick like consistency. Yum. I guess they didn't read the definition of yakitori, like the part about the "grilling" aspect.

Oh, and when we said our "itadakimasu" and upon any "thank you" to the chef...pin drop...no response. Oh man, he looked annoyed and pissed the entire excruciating meal! Wanted to get my tanto blade from the car and go Watari Tetsuya on his ass but I was more in a Totoro mood. Or maybe Golgo 13. Yes I speak Otaku.

On top of that, no one comes by to see if we need anything. Have to call out for the waitress for water, a plate, a gun, whatever.

3. Food.

This is simple. Gross. Lousy quality fish. Even the salmon was 12th grade. And that is cheap fish to do right. And don't think you can escape into Rolls and Handrolls. You can't. Because they are as bad as everything else. Drenched in sauce to make up for the disgusting taste.

All together...125 dollars and no "thank you" from the retards that run this place. Not impressed is an understatement. 

I challenge you to try OSAKA and experience the disaster that spots like Nobu made possible. So now you have two choices in Vegas. Authentic -Fake Disgusting Overpriced and Authentic-Fake OK Overpriced. Either way, there is no Japanese food other than Ichiza and Raku in Vegas. Actually, there is no Japanese food in Vegas. Cause those two options are like McDonalds in Tokyo. 

Instead, find a hot Japanese girl or guy, get your Tanto blade, and threaten them to make you a proper dinner. Make sure to check your salmon for parasites, and in the case of Osaka, the chef as well.

P.S. I feel like I may have gone a little over-board in this review and so I apologize to anyone who's feelings I may have hurt, like the a-hole chef who stole 125 dollars out from our wallets and in return gave us horrible service and food.
Came in a couple nights ago at like 1am which was great, some of the best sushi ive had in along time. Thanks!

I'm pretty sure that the people who gave this place five stars are related to the owners and therefore get better portions and deals. While I can't say the food was bad it was a complete rip off...I paid 100 for two king and queen plates (celebratory dinner for my bfs bday) the plates consist of a lobster tail and filet mignon with grilled veggies. 

The lobster was probably considered a midget given the tail size and the lobster meat had been removed and cut up and replaced in the tail where I'm sure we got smaller portions than what was initially in the tail. I mean the amount of lobster was so little I'm pretty sure they took one lobster tail cut it up cooked up and grabbed an empty tail to split it up in two portions. 

Similarly when ordering they ask how you want your filet mignon cooked however it is a useless question because they cut it up in little pieces!!! I don't know about you but I don't need help cutting up my meat I'm not a five year old, needless to say the small chunks were all very well done and again it was a very small portion. 

You would think that at the very least they wouldn't skimp on the mixed veggies since its not a high cost item but they must be on a small budget because it was not substantial. I guess they get bargain prices on rice because we got a ton of that even though neither of us eat rice. 

The food didnt taste bad though and they had nice sauces to dip your minitature meat portions into. At the end we were both left hungry and ended up getting capriottis later that night (bomb sub place that I definitely recommend) and was left feeling robbed especially after getting a better tasting and filling meal for like a quarter of the price. 

Definitely not a good place to go unless your super rich and therefore don't mind getting ripped off. That's what I get for trying to avoid the fancy restaurants on the strip to get a good deal.

Osaka is the place to check for sure in while in Vegas!! We had our wedding meet & greet family dinner here and boy was it one amazing experience we will never forget! The food & the customer service was unbelievably AMAZING!!! Manager David & staff treated us like family! We will definitely visit here every time we come!

One of my favorites places for sushi! It's definitely a dive and it's been there forever but the service and quality is top notch.  My favorite rolls are the Pocket Aces and the Fresh White, but any of the others are great too. The place has recently been seen some minor remodeling such as the carpet and walls of the sushi bar. Size of rolls isn't always consistent, just depends on sushi chef.
Loved it,small intimate, food very good, desert nummy!

Always fresh food. Seafood salad is great and must try their scallop dishes!

Another place I go every time I'm in Vegas!

I normally stop by Osaka on my way home from work to get soup and a small appetizer but I happened to be off for the evening. I placed my order for pick up and as I pulled into the lot a lady was sitting on the curb approached me. 

She was someone who probably doesn't get a meal as frequently as most and quietly asked me if I could give her my leftovers after dinner and didn't want any money. 

I went into the restaurant to get my soup and half of a sushi roll and asked the server if I could leave money for the lady outside so she could pick her meal and actually be able to sit down and eat it. A bald man who was another server chimed in and was like no you can't do that, she'll bother other customers, that's what they usually do. It's better if you get her something to go. 

I will not be returning to Osaka. That man had no humanity or compassion in him. If that's the type of people that work there, my business is not needed. A real sit down meal was all I wanted to provide for someone. Whoever that server was should be ashamed. If you can't help humankind there is no hope.
This is one of those places that only the locals know about. Best quality Sushi in town!!

The sushi chef was great but he was SUPER busy clearly preparing a huge platter and we had a hard time getting his attention to serve us. The sushi was awesome. But we wanted other items from the menu and had to tell the sushi chef because the waitress NEVER came back. Even after she delivered my husband's dish, she NEVER returned :( For as good of reviews as this place has, we expected better service or even a little bit of service. The entrance is also confusing. Which way do you go in? There needs to be some signage in the weird hallway that you enter. I'd try some where else next time we're here.

This place is awesome! Kinda pricey but its really really good. They do not have ayce(all you can eat.) its per order, the quality of the food is Amazing. The staff is very friendly and helpful on selecting food. I would definitely recommend this place if you love sushi!.

I ordered for delivery from EAT24 and let me tell you what a big disappointment! First of all the 8.99$ charge, come on you guys i live only 2miles away.. Second of all food arrived 1 hour and 45 min after i placed the order (i live only 2 miles away from the restaurant). Third of all but not last, i guess delivery driver never checked my order cause on top of that i had missing items.. I would not recommend this restaurant to non of my friends or the delivery service that is taking their orders... slow, incorrect, bad experience!!

This is the best sushi restaurant in town. We had the omakase (chef's choice) and had his specialties. The sashimi here is really fresh and tasty. The prices overall on the  menu was very reasonable. The cost on the omakase is really up to you. We told him $80/person and we had over 10 dishes. (2 of which had toro) You can always set this lower and order more later if you're still hungry. 

They do have coupons available. Check online or in the local advertisements.

Sushi and Tapan. We began with Sushi Rolls. All fresh and very tasty. Next was the Tapan table. Great chef. Did the usual show with the flying spatulas and the famous Egg Roll. The food was delicious and the service was excellent as well. As soon as someone's drink was nearly empty, our servers were all over it. This is a do over next time I'm in Vegas
Huge variety. Rolls were delish. Loved having the option of a half roll. Was able to get multiple rolls. Get the spicy garlic edemome- amazing!

This place is awesome! Extremely good service. Awesome happy hour prices. Most sushi rolls are 4-9 dollars for 12-2. This place might have gotten me hooked on sushi and I dont think I want to settle for anything less. Only reason Im giving 4 stars is because I ordered some weird sushi. Nothing against the restaurant. I just didnt know what I was ordering. Some of the sushi is served hot and I did not know that from just looking at the menu. Other than that this place is awesome. ALSO! I did not try dessert here but they have tempura ice cream and fried oreos and cheesecake here!!!

This restaurant is great for  food. It's absolutely delicious. The teriyaki chicken and the shrimp lovers combination. The flavors and the presentation is great. Mireya service was outstanding and from everyone else too ruby etc. Great place to eat and enjoy

We took a table in the Tatami Room. I would highly recommend sitting there instead of at a regular table. Where do I begin?? The menu is a notebook of options! Take your time here and don't be in a rush so you can savor the flavors. Check out the pictures and they will speak volumes! 

There is a picture of a bowl of fish. There was a plethora of fish...from mackerel to tuna to salmon to shrimp. There were so many varieties. You can share this meal. 

They make all of their own sauces. The eel sauce is amazing! And do not pass up dessert...ask for their Fried Tempura Oreo! We won't need to eat for weeks!

So far...this is the best place we've eaten in Vegas!

Just as mentioned by other yelpers the layout is really weird.. Upon entering it's a immediately hallway directing you to go right, you would think once you enter the actual "restaurant" it would be one big open space, but you walk into another room where I think the sushi bar was and a few other tables. The rest of the restaurant is divided into rooms.. We had visitors from Canada with us and I almost felt embarrassed we took them to a odd restaurant such as this in a sketchyarea. We came on a Saturday afternoon as a party of 9. The major plus is that they offer their lunch specials 7 days a week, which is good considering other restaurants only offer deals on the weekdays. I ordered the bento "b" with chicken katsu as my main entree ($10). In addition, I ordered a tiger roll, made up of 4 pieces for $8. The bento included miso soup, gyoza, tempura, a tossed salad, and 2 pieces of CA roll. Everything was pretty standard, except the CA roll seemed a little heavy on the rice and less on the crab meat. I enjoyed the tiger roll and have nothing to complain about it. The piece used for the chicken was rather thin, but still a good size. And the tempura, was good because the batter was light and not overly greasy. The service was good for the most part as they refilled our waters regularly and were attentive to us. Nothing really stuck out to me and I don't live around here so I probably won't be back.
Probably the most unimpressive entrance to a surprise find in Las Vegas for traditional Japanese fare. Tempting menu options, made for hard decisions. Our selections did not disappoint.
In Vegas for a car show and wanted Sushi....so glad we came here. Food and service were excellent. Kalbi Ribs were beyond excellent. Highly recommend Osaka.

im a big sushi fan n i got to say out of alot of place ive tried in vegas this is surely one of the BEST!!! they got amazing happy hour!..the waiters are very nice n friendly i prob come here every two weeks n they know me n my orders lol...this place is very chill n there booths are what japanese style so u take your shoes off but i really recomend coming here n tryin a few of there amazing sushi rolls!!!!!

Was really looking forward to experience the taste of the food again that I remember from my last trip to Las Vegas.  I was very disappointed in the quality of the food this time around.  Portions were ok though.  The nori used for the sushi rolls was very bad because we spent more time chewing on the nori.  The quality of the nori was just not there.  I love to eat sushi and don't think that I will return to this restaurant in my future trips to Las Vegas.

This place is great for a sushi night ! It can be a bit pricey and the sushi is kind of smaller than the average sized sushi but the quality of the sushi is just amazing makes up for it  so it's well worth the price!

We used to come here a lot but the last few times we were there, the service was really slow so we've stopped coming.
Aside from the service, the food was good.
They have unique tables that are inset into the floor, so you take off your shoes before sitting & you step down into the booth seat.
The parking lot is really small so we often had to park in the lot next door.

Thank you Guy Fieri! We were looking for a great local place to eat off the strip while on vacation in Las Vegas and checked the list on the triple D website. I am so glad we did! Osaka is almost like 3 different restaurants in one: a sushi bar, teppanyaki grill and Japanese restaurant. It is located way off the strip in a strip mall. We ate in the Japanese restaurant section that has low tables that you take your shoes off and tuck your feet under. Super fun! We ordered several sushi rolls, firecracker shrimp, miso soup and their house chicken soup. Everything was amazing! We got the Roponngi, Pocket Aces, and Kai Special rolls. My favorite was the Pocket Aces with the crunchy fried onions on top- yum! The rolls weren't super inexpensive but they were big and really fresh. Next time I'll come for happy hour. I'm so glad we tried this place. It's worth the Uber ride.

I have only come here during their happy hour per se (10pm-2am) and I or we sit at the bar.  The chefs are great and quick, the items on the late night special menu are plentiful and cheap.  The rolls are half though.  One of the dishes I ordered was the scallops, the quality of the scallops was great.  They have sake and beer on the menu too and it is affordable.  I can never drink whenever I come though.

One day I'll be able to come on a normal day and use one of those cool rooms where you sit on the floor without your shoes!  Until then, this place is definitely worth trying out.

Service (not the chefs) at the bar was ehhh..
Love this place. Best sushi in town IMO. Everybody I have taken here has loved the food. Very fresh and clean (means a lot coming from a germ freak). Lunch specials are the best!

Forget the Strip or Fremont, Sahara Ave has everything! 

Based on all of the reviews, people seem to either love Osaka or hate it. I love the place. I never had sushi before I tried Osaka and now I'm addicted. Since I'm not expert, I'll keep it short.

Why i love the place:
-Eat the volcano roll. it's the most delicious food item I've even tasted in my life.
- the rolls all come in half or whole, so you can order lots of different rolls and share.
- the place is affordable.
-The flat screen tvs at each booth have a looping slide show of everything that they sell in the place. if your conversation falls off, you can drool at the tvs.

OMG!!Not only is this really authentic Japanese food, they also deliver it direct to your hotel room. Cannot believe my luck that I found Okonimiyaki in Vegas AND didn't even have to leave the comfort of my room to enjoy it

My favorite place to eat the best delicious sushi!!! I absolutely love this place! Everything is always fresh. The service is very attentive to your need & the sushi chefs are awesome. Atmosphere is very chill & relaxed. They have it all, delicious desserts, delicious everything! Definitely a Must try!!!
